lines.text: [first lines]
Are you getting off at Austin?
[last lines]
Michael. Right?
Heard you moved.
My mother's getting married.
To who?
Good guy.
Never heard of him.
when I think about trying with you again, I have no idea if it's a moment of strength, or a moment of weakness.
Michael, when you get to be my age you realize that sometimes the planets just don't line up. And there's nothing you can do about it.
Of course sometimes they do line up. And there's nothing you can do about that either.
There's what you want, and there's what's good for you. Ah, they never meet.
They never meet.
Except for my mother and step-father.
Maybe they think they're wrong for each other.
Nah, they're too old fashion.
Then why do anything with anybody?
Because anything is better than nothing.
The idea that you think you make sense is terrifying.
Ya, I know.
A man is as big as the things that annoy him.
Nice butt.

[scared after seeing his brother watching him]
You bastard!
